references: Handel, Colleen M. and Robert E. Gill. 2001. Black Turnstone (Arenaria melanocephala), The Birds of North America Online (A. Poole, Ed.). Ithaca: Cornell Lab of Ornithology; Retrieved from the Birds of North America Online: http://bna.birds.cornell.edu/bna/species/585

habitat_description: Black turnstone's winter along the Pacific coast of North America, favoring rocky shoreline, but also inhabiting mud and sand flats, salt marshes, sandy beaches, jetties, piers, and pilings (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Gerstenberg, 1979; Handel and Gill, 2001).
